alert.note: Alert for Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 02 at 12:46PM MDT until May 07 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Shoshone and Kootenai Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at Calder. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding in riverside RV areas near Meadow and Oxbow Lanes downstream of Calder to the Cutthroat Resort. At 13.0 feet, Bear Creek will begin to back up from the St Joe River and may start to spill into the town of Calder, flooding the low spots in yards, roads and parking lots. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Friday morning and remain above flood stage through the weekend. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri St Joe River Calder 13.0 11.9 Tue 10 am PD 12.3 12.3 13.0 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1215 PM PDT.
